full_description:
Yamaha HS7 6.5" Powered Studio Monitor Speaker

The Yamaha HS7 Powered Studio Monitor is a bi-amplified monitor with accurate sound reproduction technology. It has a 6.5-inch woofer and a 1-inch tweeter with a waveguide that can create frequencies up to 30 kHz and is capable of up to 95W of total power. The XLR and 1/4" TRS inputs of the HS7 accept balanced or unbalanced signals and can be integrated into a number of studio settings.

Low Resonance Enclosure Design

The Yamaha HS7 Powered Studio Monitor is designed to eliminate unwanted resonance and increase the accuracy of sound reproduction to their extreme limit. The enclosures are constructed from a dense MDF with a damped acoustic response. HS Series engineers also employed a traditional three-way mitered-joint technique. Common to architectural design, this construction firmly anchors the corners of the enclosure to improve durability and eliminate unwanted resonance that can influence overall sound.

Noise Reduction Technology

The Yamaha HS7 Powered Studio Monitor port design can greatly influence the clarity of overall sound. Often a vortex at either end of the port can generate air vibrations inside of the port, causing unwanted noise. By adopting a noise reduction technology that incorporates an analysis of a visual representation of the sound, Yamaha's engineers are able to control and reduce the vortex. Through this analysis, Yamaha has arrived at a port design that reduces noise up to 6 dB.

Controls and Connectivity

Full-range versions from the HS Series are equipped with two response controls, each of which has a range of settings that let them adjust to the surface acoustics of variously shaped and sized rooms. While HIGH TRIM offers more flexible control of the high-frequency response, ROOM CONTROL helps you to reduce the artificial, accentuated low-end that can frequently happen when speakers are placed adjacent to walls. HS full-range speakers may accept many balanced and unbalanced sources as inputs, including mixers, keyboards, and audio interfaces with XLR and TRS phone connectors.

High-Performance Amp

The Yamaha HS7 Powered Studio Monitor speakers employ an amplifier unit perfectly matched to the transducers utilized in each model of the series. Featuring a bi-amp design with a separate dedicated amp for both the woofer and the tweeter, this amplifier unit ensures that each HS Series speaker consistently delivers high-resolution sound with an exceptionally flat response across the sound spectrum. The HS7 features a power stage supplying the woofer and a 35W power stage supplying the tweeter.

full_description:
Zoom F8n Pro Multitrack Field Recorder

The Zoom F8n Pro Multitrack Field Recorder delivers top-tier performance no matter the place you are in. This 8-channel/10-track multitrack field recorder boasts 32-bit float recording technology that gives an outstanding sound quality. This Multitrack recorder is ideal for working in independent film production, mobile media recording, or any other mission-critical application. You will get eight separate inputs with locking Neutrik connectors, plus high-quality preamps, switchable +4dB mic/line inputs, and balanced analog outputs. The Zoom F8n Pro is included with mid-side decoder, a phase inversion, and a highpass filter are also included. Also, you get dual redundant SD/SDHC/SDXC card recording, a full-color backlit LCD screen, and time-code compatibility. The F8n Pro also functions as an 8-in/4-out USB audio interface for quick DAW integration. Some notable features of the F8n Pro include remote control through a smart device, a dedicated headphone output, and flexible power choices.

Generous I/O and 32-bit float audio

The F8n Pro Multitrack Field Recorder boasts 8-inputs and 10-tracks, so it’s able to record complicated sources using numerous microphones. With the help of this field recorder's premium preamps and 32-bit float AD/DA conversion, you can make crisp, attention-grabbing recordings in full 32-bit/192kHz quality. Moreover, three outputs are provided for connecting cameras, headphones, and other devices.

Built-in USB audio interface

The F8n Pro Multitrack recorder may be used as a full-featured 8-in/4-out USB audio interface by connecting it to your computer. This not only makes it simple to integrate with your DAW, but it also gives you the option to concurrently record to an SD card and stream in 32-bit float at 96 kHz.

State-Of-The-Art Time Code & Simultaneous-Recording

The Zoom F8n Pro is fully capable of recording at a professional level. It has incredibly flexible signal routing from all inputs to all outputs, for starters. You also receive a highpass filter to reduce wind and other unwanted noise, phase inversion, and mid-side decoding. There are additional input and output delays available. At a precision of 0.2ppm, a temperature-compensated oscillator produces timecode. With the F8n Pro or a mobile device, you may also add track titles, scene names, notes, and other information. Zoom AutoMix, which automatically adjusts the level of your mix to lower ambient sound, is one of our favorite features at Sweetwater. Thanks to this feature, you can keep your eyes on the action and not on your meters.

Zoom Mic Capsule Input

A Zoom mic capsule input on the F8n Pro accommodates Zoom's line of interchangeable capsules (available separately) in place of inputs 1-2. With mid-side, X/Y, and shotgun mic capsules to choose from, you can be ready to record music, dialog, or sound effects without carting an external microphone setup.

Ambisonics Support for VR/AR and 360-Audio

Using the F8n Pro's Ambisonics mode, which features balanced gain linking and precise A-to-B encoding, you can record high-quality spatial audio for use in VR (virtual reality), AR (augmented reality), and other applications. Channels 5-8 can be used for other signals, such as boom and lav microphones or a different Ambisonics format, even while the first four channels are being used for Ambisonics recording. Real-time monitoring of your Ambisonics video is possible thanks to an integrated stereo Ambisonics monitor converter. To access user-friendly decoding and editing features for your 360-audio, download the free Zoom Ambisonics Player program.

Precision Time Code and Synchronization Features

Whether you keep the F8n Pro powered on all day, or shut it down during breaks, rock-solid sync with video cameras, master time code clocks, or additional audio recorders will be maintained. Accurate synchronization is made possible with the F8n Pro's high-end time code features. Standard BNC jacks are dedicated for time code I/O, and a Temperature Compensated Crystal Oscillator (TCXO) boasts super stable time code accuracy to ±0.2 ppm. You can even jam sync the F8n when constant external time code isn't present.

Zoom AutoMix Software Reduces Ambient Noise

The Zoom AutoMix feature makes your work easier. So that you can concentrate on recording a well-balanced mix, this clever software automatically adjusts the levels of your mix to lessen the amount of background noise. You will have full control over where you want AutoMix to function because you can turn it on or off for each channel.

Efficient Control

Zoom f8n pro multitrack field recorder can provide you with comprehensive external control if you need. The Zoom F-Control is the best option for quick and responsive hands-on remote control (sold separately). It has tactile controls for trim, pan, arming tracks, transport functions, and other things in addition to smooth 60mm faders. You can use the free "F8 Control" app on an iOS mobile device for easy wireless remote control to quickly check and adjust levels, manage transport controls, add metadata, and more.

Power for Hours

The F8n Pro offers several methods of powering. Operate it via eight AA batteries (available separately), power it through a Hirose-connected 9-18V DC battery pack (available separately), or plug it into a wall outlet with the included 12V power adapter.

full_description:
Focusrite Scarlett 2i2 3rd Generation PC Audio Interface

Built to deliver top-shelf sound in a compact, bag-friendly, and easy-to-use format for singer-songwriters, guitarists, and podcaster duos, the third-generation Focusrite Scarlett 2i2 2x2 USB audio interface lets artists and content creators score pro-level tone with no learning curve, no matter where they go. Equally capable for tracking vocals and instruments, the two improved Scarlett microphone preamps feature switchable phantom power for condenser mics and a selectable-per-channel Air circuit, which adds clarity-enhancing brightness based on Focusrite's legendary ISA preamplifier. The two XLR-1/4" combo inputs are outfitted with switches that allow them to accept signal directly from electric instruments such as guitar and bass or from line-level sources such as stereo mixer outputs or a hot feed from a drum machine. Unlocking the ability to record at standard CD quality or high-fidelity resolutions, the 24-bit / 192 kHz AD/DA converters ensure that signals are captured and reproduced with detail and accuracy. Listen through headphones or connect active speakers to the balanced 1/4" monitor outputs, and enjoy independent control of the headphone and speaker volume settings. Use selectable direct monitoring in mono or stereo to hear your live input signal with no distracting echo or latency. With its bus powering for uninhibited portability, space-saving USB Type-C connection, and extensive software bundle including elementary versions of Ableton Live and Avid Pro Tools music production workstations, virtual instruments, plug-in effects, loops, and more, the Scarlett 2i2 gives you plenty of powerful tools to kick-start your inspiration; just plug the Scarlett 2i2 into your Mac/Windows computer or iPad Pro, fire up your preferred audio recording software, and let the creativity flow. Both compact and lightweight, the Scarlett 2i2 is rugged and ready to travel with you. Being bus powered via USB Type-C connectivity, it can be used in any room or even remote locations, no AC outlet required. Thanks to its high-performance 24-bit / 192 kHz AD/DA converters, the Scarlett 2i2 is equipped to capture any source from vocals to acoustic and electric instruments clearly and accurately, so you never have to worry about the interface clouding your sound. The two upgraded third-generation Scarlett mic preamps features switchable 48V phantom power to accommodate your favorite condenser mic and a selectable-per-channel Air setting, which reproduces the Air effect of Focusrite's original ISA mic preamp to impart enhanced brightness and openness on your vocal recordings. The XLR-1/4" combo inputs on the Scarlett 2i2's front panel allow distortion-free recording of instruments such as electric guitar and bass, synthesizers, or drum machines, and there's no need for a DI box or amplifiers. At the press of a button, each 1/4" input can be used for line-level sources like a mixer's stereo output or the line outs from guitar and bass amps. With the Scarlett 2i2's Easy Start tool and independent gain knobs with multicolor gain halo meters, you'll have no trouble getting set up and dialing in the perfect levels. Plus, there are no menus or complicated controls to slow you down. The balanced 1/4" TRS monitor outputs on the rear panel ensure hum-free connectivity with balanced studio monitors. For critical listening through headphones, just plug your earphones or headphones into the front-panel 1/4" headphone jack. Separate knobs are provided for quick and independent adjustment of the monitor and headphone volumes. No musicians want to record if they can't hear their performance clearly. Use the Scarlett 2i2's direct monitor switch to listen to your input signals in mono or stereo, exactly as they are supposed to sound, with no latency and no distracting echo. The Scarlett 2i2 comes with a powerful bundle of music-making software from industry-leading brands. From recording to final mixdown, this bundle features tools that will help you get the sound you imagined.

RODE X XCM-50 Compact USB-C Condenser Microphone

The Rode X XCM-50 is a tiny USB-C microphone with built-in powerful DSP capabilities that is intended for streamers and gamers looking for professional-quality sound with simple plug-and-play operation. The cardioid polar pattern of the condenser mic capsule focuses audio capture on the topic in front of the microphone, gathering up less unwanted sound from the back and sides to guarantee that your audience and teammates hear you loud and clear. A yoke mount is supplied for easy attachment to a boom arm or mic stand, and the mount's 360° swivel movement allows for easy positioning for game play and broadcasting. A tripod support for tabletop use is also supplied.

Plug-and-Play USB-C Connectivity

The XCM-50 is powered by the USB bus and features 24-bit / 48 kHz analog to digital conversion, as well as Rode's powerful UNIFY audio software, which allows you to unlock additional features of the mic's powerful internal DSP and mix up to four USB microphones simultaneously for podcasting and streaming applications.

Complete Control of Your Audio

The accompanying UNIFY software of RODE X XCM-50 microphone allows you to control all of your audio inputs and outputs from one simple mixer. Even with the most sophisticated streaming or gaming settings, the intuitive software takes seconds to set up and is extremely simple to use, allowing you to go live with excellent audio in seconds. You can combine up to four microphones and six virtual audio devices, such as your game, chat, music, system, and browser. Using UNIFY's inbuilt recording functionality, collect and optimize your livestream audio for major audio outlets. When developing content, record in stereo or multitrack for maximum flexibility.

Craft Your Own Sound

Utilize the renowned Aural Exciter and Big Bottom in conjunction with sophisticated APHEX processing to tailor the XCM-50 s sound signature to your voice. Compressor, noise gate, and high-pass filter: these tools reduce ambient noise and restore punchy, detailed, and smooth audio. With granular control over each processor, you can fine-tune to perfection, just like you would with professional audio mixing software. All audio processing when using UNIFY with a Rode X microphone is handled by a potent DSP chip inside the microphone, relieving pressure on your CPU and allowing you to hear everything through your headphones as it happens.

full_description:
RODE X XDM-100 Dynamic USB-C Microphone

The Rode X XDM-100 is a USB-C microphone with powerful DSP and an integrated high-gain preamp designed for gaming and streaming applications. The dynamic capsule of the microphone is meant to be placed close to the subject, picking up less extraneous sounds and room reflections from further away, making the XDM-100 ideal for usage in untreated rooms and home studios. Furthermore, the cardioid polar pattern concentrates audio capture in front of the microphone, picking up less sound from the back and sides for a cleaner, clearer vocal sound.

Plug-and-Play USB-C Connectivity

The XDM-100 incorporates Rode's ultralow-noise, high-gain Revolution preamp, which is powered by the USB-C bus connection and ensures a stable signal level for the built-in 24-bit / 48 kHz analog to digital converter.A zero-latency 3.5mm headphone port with volume control and a mic mute button allows you to monitor your audio in real time and hear what the mic capsule is picking up.

Complete Control of Your Audio

The accompanying UNIFY software allows you to control all of your audio inputs and outputs from one simple mixer. Even with the most sophisticated streaming or gaming settings, the intuitive software takes seconds to set up and is extremely simple to use, allowing you to go live with excellent audio in seconds. You can combine up to four microphones and six virtual audio devices, such as your game, chat, music, system, and browser.

Craft Your Signature Sound

With powerful APHEX processing, including the famed Aural Exciter and Big Bottom, you can tailor the XDM-100's sound signature to your voice. Using a compressor, noise gate, and high-pass filter, you can remove background noise and make your music seem smooth, detailed, and punchy. Fine-tune each processor to perfection with granular control, just like professional audio mixing software. When using UNIFY with a Rode X microphone, all audio processing is managed by a strong DSP chip inside the microphone, which relieves the stress on your CPU and allows you to hear everything as it happens in your headphones.

RODE X Streamer X Audio Interface and Video Streaming Console

The Streamer X is a professional video capture card, audio interface, and control surface all rolled into one small device that makes generating amazing content a breeze. It has studio-grade audio inputs for XLR microphones and instruments, as well as headsets and RDE wireless mics, as well as an ultra-low-noise, high-gain Revolution Preamp and powerful APHEX audio processing for flawless sound quality. HDMI connectors support 4K30 streaming and 4K60 pass-through for exceptional video quality in a variety of applications, including streaming and gaming, podcasting and content production, and corporate presentations. twin USB-C connections allow for smooth twin PC configurations, and four completely configurable SMART pads enable on-the-fly triggering of sound or speech FX and other computer activities. The all-encompassing streaming solution.

The Ultimate All-in-One Streaming Solution

The Streamer X is a game-changing device that allows you to livestream in high-quality audio and video. A professional audio interface, video capture card, and control surface are now available in a single small console for the first time.

Look and Sound Incredible

The Streamer X incorporates cutting-edge technology for capturing broadcast-grade audio and video while remaining incredibly intuitive, allowing anybody, even those with no prior expertise, to stream with professional quality. It has an HDMI input for connecting a camera, gaming PC or console, or any other HDMI video source, and it supports 4K30 streaming for stunning video quality. It also supports 4K60 HDMI passthrough for high-resolution real-time monitoring with zero latency. Variable Refresh Rate (VRR) support assures smooth gaming without lag or screen tearing, and two USB-C ports make it simple to integrate with dual PC configurations.

Flexible Control On The Fly

The Streamer X is not only the world's first integrated professional audio interface and video capture card, but it's also a highly flexible control surface, rounding out the trinity of capabilities that make it the ideal all-in-one streaming solution. It has four SMART pads in addition to its hands-on audio and video controls. These powerful pads, first seen on the innovative RDECaster Pro II, may be programmed to do a number of tasks. This includes activating audio effects such as sound effects and music beds, as well as speech effects such as echo, reverb, pitch shifting, robot, and other unique FX.

Easy Configuration and Advanced Features

The Streamer X is completely compatible with RDE's desktop programs and software. This includes the simple companion program RDE Central, which can be used to activate and control the on-board processing, as well as alter any parameter using the advanced editor, much like a professional-grade plug-in. RDE Central can also be utilized to quickly obtain audio configuration profiles that are optimized for various forms of content creation, as well as to personalize the SMART pads. The Streamer X also works in tandem with RDE's free streaming virtual mixing software, UNIFY.

full_description:
Universal Audio Volt 276 USB-C Audio Interface

The Universal Audio Volt 276 takes use of UA's legendary analog expertise to create a USB-C audio interface befitting of a decades-long reputation. The Volt 276 has first-rate analog circuitry as well as class-leading 24-bit/192kHz AD/DA conversion, allowing you to produce professional-sounding music productions, live streaming, and podcasts. This bus-powered audio interface has two microphone preamplifiers, switchable 610-style analog sound, and input metering. The crown gem of this interface, however, is its built-in 1176-derived FET compressor with three push-button application modes. Aside from that, dual analog outputs and a headphones output make monitoring a breeze, and direct monitoring is available for zero-latency operation. In addition, you have MIDI I/O for your synthesizers and controllers. The Volt 276 vaunts a rugged, retro-inspired industrial design and comes with a cutting-edge native software bundle.

Armed with class-leading AD/DA conversion

The Universal Audio Volt 276 has excellent AD/DA conversion, which is a must-have feature for professional-sounding recordings. This enhanced conversion circuitry provides full 24-bit/192kHz performance, delivering true-to-life detail and clarity with a high degree of dimensionality. Sweetwater experts have discovered that projects produced with this USB-C audio interface are completely top-notch. You'll be able to make rock-solid, album-worthy tunes with the Volt 276 in your studio.

Infuses your tracks with 610-style analog sound

UA is known for its traditional analog designs, and Volt 276 exemplifies that expertise. This audio interface has two analog mic/line preamplifiers that sound uncannily identical to Universal Audio's famous 610 tube preamplifier. The Vintage Preamp Mode on the Volt 276 uses skillfully built op-amps and solid-state circuitry to provide tube-like dynamic saturation and clipping, giving you strong, intuitive tone shaping for your microphones and line-level inputs. The best part is that Vintage Preamp Mode is configurable, allowing you to use the Volt 276 with external preamps and channel strips without adding coloring.

Includes a real-deal 1176-derived FET compressor

The UREI 1176 is a classic pro studio workhorse that can add punch and presence to everything from drums to guitars to voices. The Volt 276 has an integrated FET compressor based on the vintage 1176. However, this is not a digital simulation; rather, it is a genuine analog compressor. The compressor on the Volt 276 has three simple push-button modes for Vocals, Guitars, and Fast sources (the latter is designed specifically for drumming), providing appropriate settings for every source. The Universal Audio Volt 276 USB-C Audio Interface has no warranty.

full_description:
Yamaha MG10XU 10-Input Mixer with Built-In FX and USB Interface

The Yamaha MG10XU is a tiny ten-input mixer with built-in effects designed for concerts, lectures, recordings, and other similar uses. The mixer has four mic/line combination inputs with D-PRE mic preamps and six 1/4" line inputs with stereo level controls. It also has USB connectivity and can send two channels in and out to your computer at up to 24-bit / 192 kHz, making it perfect for recording live performances, demos, and other audio. Each of the four mic/line inputs includes a 3-band EQ, pan control, and high-pass filter. The four D-PRE mic preamps have an inverted Darlington circuit and switchable 48V phantom power for use with dynamic and condenser microphones. They also each have 26 dB attenuation controls for capturing powerful sound sources like guitar amplifiers. The MG10XU mixer features dual XLR and TRS outputs for connecting to your PA system or monitor speakers. It also has a 1/4" headphone output with level control for personal monitoring, as well as additional TRS 1/4" stereo monitor outs for connecting to powered speakers, amplifiers, or digital recorders. Each MG10XU channel has a dedicated FX bus send level, and there are 24 effects presets to pick from. The dedicated FX return level control maintains the overall level of the FX bus. These effects, which include reverbs, delays, phasers, flangers, choruses, tremolos, auto-wah, distortion, and more, can be utilized to assist voices.

full_description:
Yamaha HS5 5" Powered Studio Monitor Speaker

The Yamaha HS5 5" Powered Studio Monitor Speaker a bi-amplified monitor that is designed for accurate sound reproduction. It is capable of up to 70W of total output and features a 5-inch woofer and a 1-inch tweeter with waveguide that can produce frequencies up to 30kHz. The HS5 has both an XLR and 1/4" TRS input that accept either balanced or unbalanced signals for integration into a variety of studio setups. The speakers are designed to eliminate unwanted resonance and increase the accuracy of sound reproduction to their extreme limit. The enclosures are constructed from a dense MDF with a damped acoustic response. HS Series engineers also employed a traditional three-way mitered-joint technique. Common to architectural design, this construction firmly anchors the corners of the enclosure to improve durability and eliminate unwanted resonance that can influence overall sound. Speaker port design can greatly influence the clarity of overall sound. Often a vortex at the either end of the port can generate air vibrations inside of the port, causing unwanted noise. By adopting a noise reduction technology that incorporates an analysis of a visual representation of the sound, Yamaha's engineers are able to control and reduce the vortex. Through this analysis Yamaha has arrived at a port design that reduces noise up to 6dB. The Yamaha HS5 5" Speaker feature two response controls with settings that allow them to adapt to the surface acoustics of rooms of varying shape and size. ROOM CONTROL allows you to attenuate the unnatural, exaggerated low-end that can often occur when speakers are placed next to walls, while HIGH TRIM allows for more flexible control of high frequency response. For inputs, HS full-range speakers can accommodate a range of balanced and unbalanced sources such as mixers, keyboards and audio interfaces with XLR and TRS phone jacks.

PreSonus R65 6.5" Powered Studio Monitor Speaker

The PreSonus R65 6.5" Powered Studio Monitor Speaker features a custom 6.8-square-inch Air Motion Transformer (AMT) tweeter that responds to the subtlest waveforms and the highest frequencies. This allows you to hear the â€œairâ€� and the greater sense of space that is characteristic of audiophile recordings. The R65 studio monitor's transparent and highly accurate sound makes it ideal for use in both commercial and home recording studios as well as broadcast and post-production environments. In order to dampen resonance peaks at higher frequencies, conventional dome tweeters are injected with fluid to raise their mass, sacrificing transient response time. By contrast, the custom-designed AMT tweeter in the PreSonus R65 6.5" Speaker uses an incredibly thin, folded Kapton membrane (< 0.01 mm) with an inlayed aluminum circuit functioning as the voice coil, allowing the tweeter to move at the same instant as the electric current. The resulting reactive response time provides marked clarity and superior transient reproduction. An unfolded AMT tweeter diaphragm provides 8 to 13 times the projection area of a traditional 1-inch dome tweeter, enabling PreSonus R65 6.5" Speakers to provide a much wider stereo soundstage than traditional designs. At the same time, the PreSonus R65 6.5" Speaker design provides a very limited vertical dispersion, which helps to reduce reflections from the ceiling and desktop that can cause phase coherence issues. Because itâ€™s less subject to room-anomaly interference, the PreSonus R65 6.5" Speaker reacts predictably and sounds consistent from room to room. The PreSonus R65 6.5" Speaker utilizes a 6.5-inch, woven composite, low-frequency driver. This rigid cone maintains a more consistent dispersion pattern across its frequency response range. Biamped and driven by a 150W Class D amplifierâ€”making the R-series speakers some of the most powerful studio monitors in their categoryâ€”these monitors deliver an open, clear, and less fatiguing listening experience. You can customize the PreSonus R65 6.5" Speaker in several ways. Itâ€™s available with black or blue faceplates to fit your studio dÃ©cor. With balanced XLR, balanced Â¼â€� TRS, and unbalanced RCA line-level inputs, itâ€™s easy to feed audio to your PreSonus R65 6.5" Speaker from a mixer, an interface, a media player, or almost any other line-level source. And R-series studio monitors offer user-adjustable contour features for optimizing the monitors for your mixing space. This enables full integration into any studio environment. The PreSonus R65 6.5" Speaker's design provides lifelike sonic reproduction that will allow you to hear the room in your recordings. Its transparent sound and responsive transient reproduction makes it an ideal solution for anyone who is mixing high-resolution audio. Hear the R65 studio monitor at your favorite PreSonus dealer.

full_description:
Neumann TLM 102 Large-Diaphragm Cardioid Condenser Studio Microphone

The Neumann TLM 102 large-diaphragm condenser microphone, which comes with a space-saving stand mount, offers legendary Neumann sound quality at a price point accessible to independent singer-songwriters, working musicians, and home producers. The high SPL value of 144 dB of the capsule enables the clear and distortion-free recording of powerful sound sources like as percussion, drums, amplifiers, and other instruments. The TLM 102 offers a smooth vocal presence while avoiding overt sibilance thanks to its 8 to 12 kHz treble boost. As opposed to most other polar responses, the mic's cardioid polar pattern produces directed sound pickup in front of the capsule and strong rejection behavior behind it, producing less background noise. Although extra pop filters are available for even greater control, the inbuilt pop shield suppresses breath sounds and voice plosives. The transformerless output stage of the TLM 102 provides resistance to electromagnetic interference while assisting the mic in producing a clear character with lots of bass reach.

Silky Tone

The TLM 102 was created by Neumann as a versatile tool for voice and instrumental recordings. The vital 8–12 kHz range, which is highlighted by its precisely tuned sound signature, is particularly important for human voices. The voice is given a regal presence in the overall mix, and the recordings acquire the smooth grace typical of large-diaphragm microphones. Despite this, the TLM 102 maintains its user-friendliness and handles difficult consonants or sibilants expertly because of the built-in pop shield.

No Problem with High Volume

The Neumann TLM 102 handles abrupt dynamics changes and high loudness changes without distortion. Because of this, it's a great option for drums and powerful amps. It reproduces sound pressure levels of up to 144 dB (such as a very loud trumpet at a distance of roughly 4") with excellent clarity: wide open, with strong bass and polished treble.

Neumann Sound on a Budget

The Neumann TLM 102 represents world-class audio on a tight budget. Neumann reorganized the manufacturing process and eliminated non-essential features including pattern, pad, and low-cut switches. You'll notice what they didn't leave out the moment you hear the TLM 102: the Neumann sound, which stays true to its major inspirations.

Clear and Powerful

The TLM series utilizes a transformerless output stage to provide a strong bass transmission all the way down to the lowest frequencies as well as a clear and direct sound that is extremely "close" to the acoustic source. The microphone is also robust to electromagnetic fields and lowers transmission losses thanks to its transformer-free output stage.

full_description:
Neumann TLM 103 Large-Diaphragm Cardioid Condenser Studio Microphone

The Neumann TLM 103 is a large-diaphragm condenser microphone that delivers the signature Neumann sound with enhanced presence to deliver a clear, clean, and full tone. It has a U 87-based capsule coupled with faultless transformerless circuitry, enabling it to tolerate high SPLs of up to 138 dB without distortion while keeping very low self-noise of about 7 dBA. The combination of the transformerless output stage and heightened treble response makes the TLM 103 a great choice when the sound source needs to clearly cut through the mix. The mic's compact body is ideal for positioning it in tight spots such as over a snare, inside a kick drum, or in front of a small guitar amp. By utilizing a cardioid polar pattern, the mic can effectively reduce ambient noise or instrument bleed behind the mic. The TLM 103 comes with a secure, space-saving swivel mount and a wooden box.

Affordable Alternative to the U 87

The TLM 103, which was first offered in 1997 as a less expensive replacement for the renowned U 87, has subsequently earned a place in the annals of design history. Today, the TLM 103 serves as the benchmark for evaluating modern studio microphones. The TLM 103 has a distinctly Neumann appearance because to its conventional, tapered head grille design.

Large-Diaphragm Capsule

The Neumann TLM 103 is a cardioid microphone with a large-diaphragm condenser capsule derived from the classic K67/87 capsule of the legendary Neumann U 87. However, the TLM 103 has a slightly more modern voicing with a wide presence boost for frequencies above 5 kHz.

Refined and Full Sound

Its highly direct yet polished tone is ideal for singers and solo instruments that effortlessly stand out in the mix. The TLM 103, of course, also features the renowned authoritative midrange that has become the distinguishing feature of Neumann microphones and elevated them to a top option in studios all over the world. The TLM 103's remarkably deep yet controlled bottom end is one of its unique features; it is ideal for sonorous vocals and strong bass instruments.

Technical Excellence

The TLM 103 is one of the quietest microphones on the market with an extraordinarily low self-noise of only 7 dBA. Additionally, even with low-cost preamps, audio interfaces, or old tube equipment, its exceptional sensitivity of -32.5 dBV guarantees extremely low noise. The TLM 103 can manage extremely high sound pressure levels of up to 138 dB simultaneously without the need for pre attenuation. The TLM 103 is a highly simple-to-use studio microphone because of its wide dynamic range of 131 dB, which can catch anything from a gentle whisper to a thunderous bass drum without introducing noise or distortion.

Transformerless Output

The TLM 103 is a part of Neumann's TLM series and utilizes a transformerless output stage, minimizing transmission losses and guaranteeing a highly immediate, uncolored sound that is faithful to the original as well as a clear, strong bass response, even at the highest signal levels.

Applications

The Neumann TLM 103 was initially intended for project studios and broadcast use, but because of its exceptional performance, it was quickly adopted by prestigious studios as a more contemporary-sounding substitute for the U 87 for speech, vocals, drums, guitar amps, and piano. When recording cello and double bass in classical music, the TLM 103 is frequently utilized as a spot mic.

full_description:
Neumann TLM 107 Large-Diaphragm Cardioid Condenser Studio Microphone

The Neumann TLM 107 large-diaphragm multipattern condenser microphone combines famous Neumann sound quality and enormous versatility to a budget range that's accessible to music makers and engineers working in project studios and home recording setups. The TLM 107's dual-diaphragm capsule, which was specially designed for it, provides a balanced tone that is constant across its five selectable polar patterns, making it an excellent choice for the uncolored recording of vocals and instruments. Changes to the polar pattern, pad (-6 or -12 dB), and low-cut filter (40 or 100 Hz) are made using a single control on the mic's back. The TLM 107 can be used with sound sources up to 153 dB when the -12 dB pad is engaged, making it possible to record percussion, drums, amplifiers, and other loud instruments without distortion. A treble boost above 8 kHz helps the mic maintain detail and articulation while avoiding pronounced sibilance. Thanks in part to the transformerless circuitry, the TLM 107 yields only 10 dBA of self-noise, further enhancing its transparent nature.

Pro-Level Accuracy for Home Studios

True high-definition sound quality is available at a reasonable cost with the Neumann TLM 107. This microphone was created by Neumann for project and home studio users who desire to record an uncolored sound picture that is faithful to the original source in order to maintain all post-processing and mixing possibilities. The TLM 107, on the other hand, has all the adaptability needed to produce a high-quality recording of any source in any circumstance.

Updated Looks and Controls

The TLM 107 was given a modern makeover by Neumann, despite the fact that its broad, tapering headgrille resembles renowned Neumann designs from the past, such the M 49 tube microphone. In addition to controlling the low-cut filter (linear, 40 Hz, or 100 Hz) and polar patterns (omnidirectional, wide cardioid, cardioid, hypercardioid, or figure-8), the sleek navigation toggle on the back of the microphone is a delight to use.

Dual-Diaphragm Capsule

The newly developed dual-diaphragm condenser capsule is specially designed for the TLM 107 to offer an outstanding transient response and an extended, carefully balanced frequency response for all polar patterns. This means you can adjust the directional pattern according to the recording situation without affecting the overall sound balance, which is quite uncommon for a large-diaphragm microphone.

Neumann Engineering

The TLM 107 is a part of Neumann's TLM series and uses a transformerless circuit to function, guaranteeing an open, transparent sound and a complete, unconstrained bass transmission even at maximum volume. To lessen rumbling and account for the proximity impact during close-miking, there are two low-cut options available. The TLM 107 can tolerate extremely high sound pressure levels of up to 141 dB without clipping (up to 153 dB with attenuation) even without using the two-pad settings. An extremely quiet recording studio's background noise is substantially louder than the TLM 107's self-noise, which is just 10 dBA. In other words, the TLM 107 won't amplify undesired distortion or add noise to your recordings.

full_description:
Neumann U 87 Ai Set Large-Diaphragm Multipattern Condenser Microphone

The U 87 Ai's dual-diaphragm capsule, which is elastically suspended, allows for the choosing of three polar patterns (Omni, cardioid, and figure-8) to increase versatility in the studio. In addition, the mic has a switchable -10 dB pad that allows it to catch SPLs up to 127 dB without distortion, as well as a low-cut filter for regulating the development of low-frequency material. Whether employed for broadcast, stage, or studio applications, the U 87 Ai has the sought-after beauty, sound, and reputation of a real classic.

The Gold Standard

The Neumann U 87 Ai is maybe the most well-known and widely used studio microphone in the world. Its exquisite external design is as well known for its smooth and refined sound as it is for its smooth and refined sound. The U 87 Ai is the industry standard for speech and singing. Its three polar patterns, as well as pad and low-cut choices, allow it to be used in a variety of applications.

Omnipresent and Special

The Neumann U 87 Ai is a magnificent work of art. It was introduced in 1967 and has influenced the sound of innumerable successful recordings over the last 50 years. When those tunes were revealed on the radio, many a DJ sat down in front of a U 87 Ai. The U 87 Ai is a large-diaphragm condenser microphone at its finest. Its tapering form and classic appearance have become part of popular cultureâ€”this is how a studio microphone appears. The same can be said for its sound; the U 87 Ai embodies studio quality and has become the gold standard against which other microphones are judged. The U 87 Ai is distinguished by its unique blend of linearity and personality. Although the U 87 Ai's on-axis frequency response is very flat, it does have a certain personality that makes it both adaptable and readily recognized.

100% Authentic German

The Neumann U 87 Ai Set is made of 100% Authentic German technology. Technically, the U 87 Ai is a conventional design with a timeless formula that hasn't altered in decades. The U 87 Ai employs the same dual-diaphragm condenser capsule architecture as its forefather, the renowned U 67 of the early 1960s. Its head amplifier, like its tube-driven predecessor, is founded on the same design ideas, but the U 87 Ai executes them with a FET circuit with a minimum signal path and a transformer-balanced output, assuring maximum signal integrity and good common-mode rejection.

Versatile Applications

As a consequence, the studio microphone has unrivaled clarity. You only have to decide on the number of faders and local mic amps you desire because the Soundcraft Si Expression 3 Digital Mixer console in the range has the same feature set. There is a model to suit every need in the range, which includes the incredibly portable 19" rack mount Expression 1 and the powerful Si Expression 3, with its 32 mic/line inputs and 30+2 faders. The Si Expression 3 consoles include buses, output processing, and connectivity to match the diversity of the inputs. Additionally to the left, right, and center busses, the bus and matrix mixes are supplemented by four additional mix busses that are assigned to the inbuilt Lexicon FX processors. Every bus mix has an always-available compressor, 4-band equalization, BSS graphic equalization, and delay. All models have extensive output connectivity, including a 64x64 option slot, 16 balanced line outputs, headphone monitor out, and AES out.

Large Mix Capacity with 66 Inputs

The Si Expression 3 has four line inputs, four internal stereo FX returns, AES in, and 32 recallable mic preamps (16 on Si Expression 1 and 24 on Si Expression 2). It also has a 64x64 expansion slot, which provides ample room to utilize all 66 input processing channels. Four mute groups, FaderGlow to light the way so you are never lost, and a thorough automation system keep everything under control. Each input processing channel includes dedicated processing for a high-pass filter, input delay, gate, compressor, and four-band EQ.

Lexicon FX Processor based on MX400

Four stereo Lexicon FX processors based on the MX400 are integrated into all Si Expression 3 consoles to supplement the channel and bus processing. These processors offer a wide range of sounds, user-adjustable parameters, and dedicated tap-tempo keys. Because the effects are hardware-based, using them all, even on the most taxing programs, does not negatively impact other operations in any way. No matter what you do, you may access all dynamics, EQs, filters, delays, and GEQs.

Flexible On-Board I/O Options

By utilizing any of the ViSi Connect Si series option cards, such as MADI USB Combo, BSS Digital Audio Bus (BLU Link), Dante, CAT5 or optical MADI, AVIOM, CobraNet, and others, you can be confident that your Si Expression seamlessly connects with other system components. The card is for MADI. The Si Expression can be linked to any Soundcraft or Studer stagebox to increase the I/O power and versatility, in addition to serving as an interface for plug-in systems such as the Soundcraft Realtime Rack or multi-track recording systems. Not only can you mix several channels at once with a stagebox added to a Si Expression, but it also expands your available input selection! As they say, "Power is nothing without control." In this regard, the Si Expression shines thanks to its extensive yet "easy to use" control surface, which includes a row of global mode encoders, a color touch screen, and specialized controls for each parameter.

Midas M32 40 Channel Digital Mixer Console

Midas M32 Digital Mixer Console is your "mind-to-sound" interface, the point where production and creativity converge. Regardless of your familiarity with digital mixers, the M32's user-friendly interface provides a seamless mixing experience that makes you feel right at home. The workflow removes barriers, diversion, and hesitancy from the very beginning of usage. The M32 Channel Strip consolidates the most crucial channel processing parameters into a single strip, ensuring that the controls remain consistent regardless of the channel you are utilizing. This incredibly effective design is the result of decades of console design experience at MIDAS as well as user feedback. From any viewing position, optimal control illumination guarantees a clear indication of levels or conditions. You may adjust the preamp settings, frequency shelving, dual dynamics sections, multi-mode fully parametric EQ, bus sends, main, mono, and stereo panning, and more with illuminated rotary encoders and switches. On the M32, there are eleven well-positioned view buttons that correspond to different features. These buttons allow you to quickly get details about that particular function. For example, when you click the View button in the Equalizer section, the main display immediately displays the EQ information for that channel, allowing you to change all associated parameters in detail. A few user-definable controls are available on several digital consoles, but the Assign portion of the M32 sets a new benchmark with 36 fully customizable options spread across three levels.

Industry-First 192 kHz Accuracy

The M32 console is a breakthrough mid-format live console that combines industry-leading 192 kHz ADC and DAC converters, a future-proof floating point audio engine, an incredibly low-latency design, and legendary Midas sound quality with cutting-edge digital technology. The incredibly elegant design of the M32 provides an incredibly opulent mixing experience. Exquisite building materials, such as carbon fiber, offer unmatched strength and durability in addition to being far lighter than similar consoles. Award-winning Midas PRO Series microphone preamplifiers and specially created Midas PRO motorized faders, rated for one million life cycles, three times longer than those of rival top consoles are used in the M32. The Midas M32 is a cutting-edge console that sets the standard for live mixing very high.

Legendary MIDAS Audio Quality

For engineers and performers, it matters most that the MIDAS M32 design and construction will undoubtedly draw attention. And that's where the M32 really shines; it comes from a renowned pedigree that essentially sets the standard in electrical design and sound quality, making it the newest in a long series of immaculate-sounding MIDAS consoles. Since groups like Billy Joel, Yes, The Beach Boys, Pink Floyd, and others brought MIDAS consoles to prominence forty years ago, the MIDAS tradition has always been about unwavering quality and the best possible sound reproduction. Audiophile Cirrus Logic multi-channel, 192 kHz-capable A/D converters with a 114 dB dynamic range provide remarkably low distortion and low noise performance, supporting the analog input section.

Daylight Viewable 7-Inch Display Screen

The 7-inch full-color, day-viewable TFT (Thin-Film Transistor) display on the M32 provides the necessary configuration parameters at the appropriate time. TFT is perfect for concert and outdoor festival events because of its strong contrast performance and outdoor visibility. Surrounded by highly accurate, context-aware tactile encoders, the screen activates and instantly displays in vivid detail any modifications made to an extensive array of parameters. With just one or two button taps, users can easily handle essential operations like effects, metering, routing, and much more thanks to the intelligent design.

All channel/bus EQs have a 100-band RTA

Showcasing spectrograph views and a complete bar, the M32-EDIT control application offers a 100-band real-time analyzer (RTA). This high-resolution RTA captures a full 10-second sonogram window and shows the audio energy distribution over time in 100 frequency bands. You can alternate between the combined view, which places the RTA view above the channel and bus EQ curves, and the big RTA view, which shows any available signal at full screen resolution. This tool allows you to directly view the audio spectrum as a result of your filtering selections. Furthermore, the RTA can be positioned above the FX rack's 31-band graphic EQs. Frequency management and monitoring have never been simpler!

full_description:
AKG K52 Professional Closed Back Studio Monitor Headphone

The AKG K52 Professional Closed Back Studio Monitor Headphone offers a closed-back design that protects the sound from the outside environment and avoids leaking. It contains 40 mm speakers that provide a wide frequency range of 18 - 20000 Hz, ensuring balanced and precise sound reproduction. It has a sensitivity of 110 dB SPL/V @ 1 kHz and an impedance of 32 ohms, making it suitable for most audio devices and sources. It has a maximum input power of 200 mW, which implies it can tolerate high volume levels without distortion. The AKG K52 is lightweight and durable, featuring a self-adjusting headband and soft ear pillows that give a snug and pleasant fit. It includes a 2.5-meter cable that allows for considerable mobility and flexibility. It also contains a 3.5 mm jack plug and a 6.3 mm screw-on adapter for connecting to various devices and equipment. The AKG K52 is ideal for studio mixing, monitoring, and hi-fi listening because it produces a realistic, accurate sound that allows you to hear every nuance and detail of your music. The AKG K52's sound quality and comfort will appeal to musicians, producers, and audiophiles alike.

Professional Drivers

The AKG K52 headphones provide strong, kept low-frequency response, giving kick drums and bass guitar clarity. At the same time, the delicacy in singers, guitars, and acoustic instruments is revealed by the detailed yet finely balanced high-frequency response. Its large 40mm drivers provide great sensitivity for strong output, as well as an extended frequency response that displays every detail. The K52s also have a low-impedance construction that makes them compatible with a wide range of playback devices, from professional studio equipment to portable music players.

Closed-back Design

The closed-back design of the K52 headphones reduces audio leakage and directs sound directly to your ears. You won't hear the drummer drop his sticks in the middle of tracking, and the click track won't be picked up by the mic in your headphones. The redesigned acoustic chamber that lies between the ear cup and the hinge that attaches to the headband is responsible for the outstanding level of audio isolation. The revolutionary design of AKG allows you to rotate your head in any direction without letting sound in or out. No matter where you choose to create, the K52 will provide you with a private workplace.

The Style That Fits All

The PreSonus Eris E3.5 is a pair of 3.5" 2-way 25W Studio Sound monitors meant for artists, producers, and audio engineers in home studios, project studios, and commercial facilities. A 3.5" Kevlar woofer and a 1" silk dome tweeter driven by a 25W class AB amplifier produce a frequency response of 80 Hz to 20 kHz in each monitor. The PreSonus Eris E3.5 2-Way 25W Studio Sound Monitor can tolerate a maximum peak SPL of 100 dB. A rear bass-reflex vent improves low-frequency range. full_description:
Beyerdynamic DT 990 Pro Open-back Studio Headphone

These open-back studio headphones are a reliable tool for any sound enthusiast. The wide stereo image and three-dimensional sound reproduction make the beyerdynamic DT 990 PRO headphones a loyal companion for producers. Outstanding tonal depth ensures that even small changes in the positioning of the acoustic source can be perceived while mixing. For decades now, professional users all around the world have placed their trust in our classic range: DT 770/880/990 PRO. These benchmark-setting studio headphones, available in three different models, boast extremely detailed resolution and very transparent sound. The circumaural headphones with their open-back design provide exceptional spaciousness and detailed tonal depth. Their mild bass and treble boost ensures a pleasant sound. The bass is not overstated but rather precise and the treble boost is powerfully present without sounding sharp. The single-sided cable allows the headphones to be put on and taken off frequently without cables getting tangled, and soft, adjustable ear cups provide for added comfort. The robust spring steel headband design ensures that the over-ear headphones also offer a secure fit. The DT 990 Edition headphones for use at home and the DT 990 PRO studio headphones: Soundwise, both models are identical as they feature identically designed acoustic transducers. There are fundamentally two differences between the models. Firstly, the Edition models have a softer headband for enjoying music at home whereas the PRO headset has a slightly firmer fit. Secondly, the Edition models come equipped with a straight cable whereas the PRO models come with a coiled cable. One aspect that sets our products apart from the rest is that they are handmade in Germany. We are particularly proud of the durability of our products, because all the components used are replaceable if necessary.

JBL LSR305 5" Powered Studio Monitor Speaker

The JBL LSR305 5" Powered Studio Monitor Speaker has a multitude of features that makes it a very special kind of speaker for any professional studio. The sound quality of the JBL LSR305 5" Speaker is exquisite and gives the most accurate of sound output. The Image Control Waveguide was developed for JBLâ€™s new flagship M2 Master Reference Monitor and with the introduction of the JBL 3 Series, is now included for the first time in an affordable, compact reference monitor. The patent-pending design of the Image Control Waveguide precisely controls the sound emanating from the speaker in the vertical and horizontal planes ensuring the presentation at the listening position is neutral and accurate. The 3 Series long-throw woofer and its damped woven composite Neodymium tweeter are designed from the ground up to reproduce the powerful transients and micro dynamics of your mix. These drivers deliver impressive deep bass and smooth high frequency response beyond the range of human hearing. JBLâ€™s Patented Slip Stream low frequency port design works in concert with the woofer to produce deep bass response at all playback levels. The double-flared shape of the port is precisely engineered for greater low-frequency extension and reduced turbulence. 3 Series efficient Class D Amplifiers provide abundant power to deliver the output and dynamic headroom needed for the most demanding production styles. Balanced XLR and 6 mm TRS inputs give you the options you need to connect your 3 Series to any signal source while maintaining professional signal quality. The -10 dB/+4 dB sensitivity switch ensures compatibility with a broad range of signal sources, allowing you to connect the 3 Series to high output professional gear without any danger of input overload. LF Trim and HF Trim â€œTRIMâ€� switches for both the Low and High Frequencies give you excellent control over the 3 Series sound in â€œyourâ€� room. Use these to fine-tune the amount of bass and treble you hear to compensate for room acoustics, program material and your personal taste. Prior to becoming a production-ready design, each 3 Series model is subjected to JBLâ€™s tough 100 hour power test, in which the speaker is required to play continually at full output for 100 hours without failure. This demanding test ensures your 3 Series speakers will deliver years of reliable performance. While most manufacturers take only a single on axis measurement of the speakerâ€™s performance, this doesnâ€™t tell how it will sound in your room. JBLâ€™s LSR Linear Spatial Reference design criteria requires seventy-two measurements yielding more than 1,200 times more data, enabling JBL to engineer a speaker that â€œsounds rightâ€� in any working space. With LSR design, 3 Series Studio Monitors deliver superior accuracy regardless of the size and shape of your room, so your mixes â€œhit their markâ€� when heard on any playback system.

full_description:
Solid State Logic SSL 2 USB Audio Interface

The SSL 2 interface has the same pure sound and exceptional build quality that SSL is known for. The SSL2 provides pro-studio sonics in a tiny form size, thanks to two class-leading microphone /line /instrument inputs and 24-bit/192 kHz converters from industry-leading manufacturer AKM. The SSL2 can weather several excursions between remote recording sites since it is housed in a strong, stylish chassis with Neutrik connections and Alps pots. The front panel design offers a straightforward workflow, easy-to-read meters, and an ergonomically pleasing feel. Furthermore, its high-current headphone amp enables precise monitoring, allowing you to be confident that what you've recorded is exactly what you're hearing.

Legacy 4K button 

The Solid State Logic SSL2 Audio Interface has a Legacy 4K button. Legacy 4K is a brand-new analog enhancement effect inspired by the personality of an SSL 4000 series console (often referred to as '4K'). We've reduced two important aspects of 4K sound into a single-circuit with the Legacy 4K button, which you may use to breathe new life into 'boring' or 'dull-sounding input sources.

Bundled SSL Native and third-party software

The Solid State Logic SSL2 Audio Interface comes with a full production bundle that includes third-party software from Avid, Ableton, and Native Instruments, as well as over 1.5GBs of Loopcloud samples. Aside from this strong software package, the SSL2 has two SSL Native channel strips: Vocalstrip 2 and Drumstrip. You can simply generate an expressive and impactful vocal sound with Vocalstrip's four vocal-specific processors, De-Esser, De-closer, 3-Band EQ, and Compander. To add clarity, punch, and heaviness to any drum recording, Drumstrip includes five carefully selected processing tools, including a transient shaper, drum gate, high- and low-frequency enhancers, and the iconic Listen to Mic compressor. The Solid State Logic SSL2 Audio Interface has no warranty.
